Black Ops 3 multiplayer is pretty similar to BO2 and BO1 in that it has map design that feels fair wherever you are, time to kill is about 4 bullets mid-range instead of 2-3 in other series, and the lag-compensation feels familiar to the BO series. The MP adds a class system where you get special class ability depending on a timer that shortens itself with better performance that is similar to Titanfall's titan acquisition mechanic. Double-jumps and wall-run doesn't feel as twitch-y as Advance Warfare's boosting, which is a good thing because AW players abused the hell out of it. Pick 10 system is polished and you can load it up all on guns or on your gameplay abilities. Also compared to AW, the killstreaks are much more attainable. No death in this game feels cheap or unfair, which is a huge plus in my book. I play this game with a 360 controller, and my K/D is about 1.2. People playing with keyboard and mouse will destroy you in face-to-face situations, but a lot of CoD is about spatial awareness, map awareness, approach/flank tactics, being hidden, and locating others, so the game is still very approachable with controller.  If you like casual shooting mulitplayer games, this is one of the best experience that is not Titanfall that available right now.

Zombies: I'm not a huge fan of Treyarch zombies, but the nostalgia of 'The Giant' is amazing. In addition, from what I've heard, they say zombies is a lot more complex this time around.  Mulitplayer: Well, it's good, but not as good as Advanced Warfare. While the game does benefit from interesting movement mechanics and specialist abilities, the pacing, balance, and team balance is way off compared to last year's COD. You'll have your soundwhoring perks and two hit melee attacks because people demanded it without any logical stance behind it.  Overall, Black Ops III is a good game, but far from being perfect. Others may like it more than I do, but who knows.

I have some seriously mixed feelings about this game, and I'll try to capture everything I can in this review, but for now, I have to say that you should buy at your own risk.  First off, I've always been a huge fan of all the Treyarch titles, seeing as they seemed to be the only Call of Duty titles with actual changes between each game, but I have to say that I am completely disappointed with this particular title... The multiplayer feels as if it hasn't changed since the second game, and the damn voices that you hear saying 'Team Deathmatch' and 'UAV online' haven't even changed, I'm pretty sure. On top of that, the poor PC optimization has made this game more than just a process to set up and play. Though I can't really base my opinion on the game for that and only that, seeing as most games always have small slip-ups just after release.  Secondly, the campaign is so glitchy, and broken in framerate and performance, that it is just unplayable after a few minutes. Campaign was always the first thing I played whenever I got the newer games, and I always loved the Treyarch stories... But this one is just so unengaging, and barely interesting... I lost interest due to the lack of a real 'hook' introduction. It's not my GPU or CPU, seeing as I've been able to run GTA5, and a few more games on ULTRA with 60 FPS and no problems at all! I just built the damn computer.  Now the Zombie mode... I LOVE zombies. And the remake of Der Riese is fantastic to play around on with friends, seeing as IT'S NEARLY IMPOSSIBLE TO FIND A SERVER ONLINE FOR IT. Not only that, but the fact that it's exclusive content kind of pisses me off, seeing as I think everybody should have that map with their game... It's not even all that changed, really. WHAT THE HELL IS THIS NEW ZOMBIES MAP THING! HONESTLY I DON'T EVEN KNOW WHAT THE F*** IS GOING ON WHEN I TRY AND PLAY IT!!! I'm so damn behind in the whole 'What to do' in zombies, seeing as I stopped listening to those damn easter egg things because they used to be an optional thing. NOW, it's almost like a 'You need to do the same f***ing easter egg every time you play the game to progress slightly and get the same outcome.' Which is a nice little thing on the side, but it takes away from the whole classic zombies feel... I feel as if all my countless hours and hours of playing zombies when I was younger, just don't count at all towards this game. That may be a good thing to some, but to me, it makes me feel as if I've been excluded from the very game mode I bought this game for... I hope there are some better maps and fix patches in the future.   Until the game is properly optimized, and most/all problems are addressed, I'm leaving this as a 'Do not buy, unless you're patient for future patches'

Well having put a few hours into this game, I feel like the reviews for this game are very very unfair.   I, like many players, have had no performance issues whatsoever, although I run the game on medium settings at 1920x1080 at 80Hz, capped to 90fps max. The FPS has never dropped below 80, with an i5 4670k and an R9 270X that seems very good.  As for the game itself:   For the first time in years I was actually pretty hyped for this. Having put lots of hours on black ops 2 (XBOX 360 lel) I had high expectations of this game. And boy it has delivered so far. Black ops 3 does feel fantastic. The multiplayer is awesome, improving massively on gunplay and movement- no more do I use just 2 or 3 outstanding weapons, I constantly find myself using lots of different guns, a first for me in CoD. The specialists offer something new and is a good idea- I like having the choice of 9 specialists and their abilities.  I haven't played much of the campaign so I don't know what that is like, but after playing the first mission it seems alright.  As for zombies:   I love it. I mainly play zombies more than multiplayer and this time treyarch have done extremely well after the calamity that was tranzit. The default map, shadows of evil, is huge, expansive and challenging. I'm still now figuring new things out about the map. Also, the XP system adds something new as well as the gum ball power ups- as well as the DLC maps, zombies could be classed as an entirely different game, it's that good so far.  Overall, this CoD is the best in years, and after a few performance related patches and fixes, the game should run well enough for most. Do I recommend it? Absolutely.

Quick tips:  For systems with 8GB of RAM: Use High texture settings at most. Never touch extra until you want to get a crash every 5 minutes. Oh, and try to use a clean Windows. Mine uses 1.5GB of RAM with Steam open.  Settings that eat almost your entire GPU power:   - Shadow Map Quality : Same as Metal Gear Solid V : Ground Zeroes and The Phantom Pain, it enhanced the resolution of the shadow maps AND increase the rendering range of those and quantity. That's very performance killer. - Order Independent Transparency : Lowering from High to Medium looks almost the same, and provides a good performance boost. - Volumetric Lightning : Same as OIT, it just lowers the resolution of the effect to a sufficient one. - Ambient Oclussion : Same as Shadow Map Quality, putting it on High or Extra enhances the range of the objects that are rendered with the oclussion. Medium Quality still looks good for near objects and characters, and gives a little boost of performance. Campaign Pros: + Fun campaign with a co-op choice + Very good voice acting + Nice weapon and cybernetic upgrade system + Standalone zombies campaign with a better story than the original + Amazing sound track  Cons: - Poor script writing (lots of silly one liners that happen when you are fighting the enemies, and they keep repeating until you move on) - Story was not as great as the black ops 1 and 2 campaigns.  Multiplayer Pros: + Gameplay mechanics feel diffrent than the previous cod games with new learning curves (thrust jumps, wall running). + Weapon balancing is great and there is a great variety in weapon choice in lobbies + The specialist system adds a lot more variety to the game making the multiplayer alot more fun + Paintshop and emblem creators allow for the people who have the skill, to be able to show off their designs and the paint shop lets you make your own camos that you can have in game + All the maps utilize the new mechanics with wall running and thrust jumping opportunities everywhere + Lots of challenges in the game that make you want to continue to play the multiplayer ( prestiging, camos , calling cards) + The free run mode allows for begginers to learn about the new game mechanics  + Lots of the bugs have been hammered out since launch and the game runs perfectly on my pc (you can literally tweet pcdev on twitter with your issues and they will get it fixed asap) + Lots of in game content avaivable in the black market like gestures, camos, calling cards, custom reticles, decals, and weapons (yes, I know right now the supply drops system sucks due to cod points but other than the weapons in supply drops thing, all the gestues and camos make you want to grind the game so you can get it) + Good support for the game post launch like dlc map packs and the release of mod tools soon  Cons: - Due to the small PC player base it is hard to find matches for game modes like demolition or free for all. - Some of the maps have really poor map design with lanes that blatantly tell you this is a wall running spot instead of it being integrated with the map - SUPPLY DROPS   Zombies Pros: + Very interesting setting for a zombies game feeling completly seprate from the multiplayer and the campaign. + Much more complex mechanics (pack a punch rituals, sword upgrade quests and the easter egg in general) + Interesting addition to the zombies storyline + Weapon customizing adds more re play value as one game you could only level up a pistol while another game you can level up your  + Gobble gums allow for more complex gameplay (it just isnt buy all the perks and you are set, you can also buy gobblegums) + Good voice acting from all the characters (The game has Jeff Goldblum in it, need I say more)  Cons: - No cons here.   Final Verdict: This game is definitly worth buying and you should even get the season pass while you are at it, the sheer content available in the game is definitly worth the money and mod tools are releasing soon so this game will definitly still be played for years to come. TL:DR:   This game is not worth it. I regret my purchase and each hour I wasted on this game. If you want a true wall running, fun, arena shooter with fresh ideas and balanced gameplay. Please check out Titanfall. It is leagues better than any shooter Ive played the past couple years and is 10 bucks, all dlc now free.   Performance / General:   With a i7-4900hq (3.2hgz) and a gtx 870m (3gb at 1100mhz) I run this game at 50% render of 1028, graphics all low settings. Meanwhile Im running Overwatch at 1080, high, 90+fps. Running Fallout 4 high, 1080 (AO and advanceds off) at 55+. I can run Cod Advanced Warfare at 1080 Extra / High, 90fps. The point Im making here is that this game is terribly optimized. Also there are very strange matchmaking protocols. You cannot group or play with people in multiplayer if one has campaign installed and one doesnt. According to Activision support, this was by design.   Single Player:  First glance seemed a simple story that was slightly convoluted but still entertaining. A world with techonogy and humanity intermingling. Upon second glance i realized Id never know what was actually going on. Basically the story is like Inception. A story within a story, you have to go deeper. Also, the online coop was cool but pretty laggy. But then again, this is COD. Most people only play the campaign once. It was a fun ride, but AW had a better campaign.   Multiplayer:   Maps are asethetically cool, but literally every map suffers from stale 3 lane design. This isnt necesarily a bad thing, but it feels very unnatural since the maps are so small and tight quarters. Some maps just seem like reskins of others. The balance of perks and weapons was tolerable, except for shotguns. Shotguns with a laser sight outrange smgs. Balancing was honestly better at launch. The wall running was a cool idea, but in the interest of saving the game for the 'anti-future' crowd, theyve gimped it to a turtle pace. There are still unfinished features (highlights, emblem and playercard sharing, theater mode clip sharing, and audio sections all still say 'coming soon' as of July 2016, nearly a year after release.) Mod tools have also been in production since game release. More than likely waiting until after dlc 4 to encourage dlc purchases. Ultimately I am disgusted with the supply drop system. During beta 'legalspeak' was used to convince the playerbase supply drops would be cosmetic only. 6 months later there were akimbo shotgun pistols and a host of weapons more powerful than base guns, only obtainable by random chance gambling. Massively gameplay altering weapons locked behind random chance paywall, even to people like myself who paid $100 for digital deluxe preorders. Now there are hero abilities locked behind these as well. Obviously I feel this is a slap in the face, and I have nothing nice to say.   Zombies:  Ive admittedly havent played much zombies on this one. The maps were very involved and complicated, even just to find perks and pack a punch required some 30 minute ritual to be done. Classic wave defense zombies and fighting the horde for fun are no more. Easter eggs have become a requirement to function and the zombie community has turned elitist to those who dont pour hours researching these steps.    Score: 5/10 fanboys screaming the next cod will be better.... for the 4th year in a row.

Guess Activision hates PC gamers. -The mobility options from Advanced Warfare made it into this game. I find these mobility options frankly add nothing to the game except making it a jump fest like some old school FPS. I don't mind that in old school shooters but in a modern shooter like COD it doesn't fit well. -Black Ops 2 had decent character building, guess they felt the need to once again continue the gimmicky character set up once again that continued from Ghost. -They introduced a bunch of concepts in Ghost, and felt that despite Ghosts being of mixed quality it should be done over and over again! Nothing has improved from what Ghosts has done.  TL;DR: Sucks on PC in my opinion, COD: Ghosts just keeps getting reskinned and the decent qualities of the games pre ghosts seems lost. This game has more content then you can ever imagine so the price is way fair at full. Zombies is obviously the reason you want this game though right? I am happy to tell you it's more beutiful than ever in this game and proposes a good challenge. Compared to other past COD zombies experiences, this one is much more challenging. You may take that as good or bad depending on your experience with older versions. Shadows of Evil, the base game zombies map, requires setup each playthrough before getting basic necessities like PaP open. This may also be taken as good or bad depending on whether you like the setup phase or not. I will say that the beginning setup can get tedious. However beyond that there is way more you can do that is quite fun like upgrading the swords. After a basic setup in zombies (which you kind of need), you can move onto the real fun. Personally, I would like to be able to skip the Pap rituals and other setup each playthrough but it's nothing I can't handle. Zombies come outside of windows 3x as fast in this game but it takes them an additional hit to kill you compared to older. The ranking system for zombies makes sense in this title and doesn't interfere with gameplay (hardly atleast). Shadows of Evil can entertain me for hours alone.... so what about The Giant? The Giant is unfortunatley a season pass holders map bringing back the simpler things in zombies for the casual player. Any fan of COD would probably get the season pass knwoing that each dlc is huge, however you may not have the additional money and it isn't at all necessary. That is your choice, and BO3 certainly makes it a tough one. The Giant is my personal favorite zombies map of the two for it's simplicity and golden camping spot! Shadows of Evil is still great and features more to do.  Enough zombies... what about multiplayer? Multiplayer is also fun in this game and has a lot for you to do when you first play. Gold camo is one of the best things to go for in this game that then leads to diamond and DARK MATTER! You can use these unlocked camos in zombies and the grind to get them is surprisingly really fun. There are a lot of problems with multiplayer that could hinder your expereince sadly. Nothing of bugs, however, some weapons are incredibly unbalanced and spawns seem to swap 24/7. This makes it hard to run a killstreak as people kill you before you realize it. After getting a feel for multiplayer, you can work around this and infact turn the game on your oponent. Everyone has a specialist ability in this game that charges throughout the match, each OP in their own way. Killstreaks are OP aswell, but are well deserved and hard to get. I didn't expect to enjoy multiplayer when I baught this game however really did despite it's problems. Weapon customization is better than ever in this game and you can even customize your character! Complete some challenges with each character that make you really get a feel for each, and you can even get golden armor! Multiplayer rewards hansomely for grinders and doesnt overpower one player over another!  Campaign? The campaign takes a while to get into but is multiplayer (up to 4 players!) and is long enough to satisfy. Oddly, voice acting within the campaign feels sluggish, whereas the rest of the game is enticing... The missions include action, bosses, and new components that seem to appear in one level only. For example, one mission allows stealth while another has you parkour across a city chasing a hoodie. Mostly, campaign insists of shooting and running to reach your goal. Missions change environments alot from human warfare at desert to surprise robot attacks underground a creepy facility. The campaign is 100% do able alone and features difficulty selection like you'd expect. For me, it was fun, but only after cool little things started to kick in and story started to pick up. You can level in campaign and unlock cool outfits aswell as find nifty decorations to customize your very own base! Campaign isnt the highlight of this game but is still pretty cool and has it's moments. I would buy a different game for a good campaign experience as it feels more like the bonus of this title...  So what about the games actual bonus modes? Theres Dead Ops Arcade, Nightmare, and Freerun. Dead Ops Arcade is a little addition to your zombies expereince that puts you eagles eye view to fight changing undead. Theres game changing powerups (much more than normal zombies), different zombie types (like skeletons), and minigames as you travel onward the maps. Multiplayer up to 4 players in Dead Ops Arcade and Nightmare mode. Nightmare mode is basicaly zombies in the campaign, with mystery boxes thrown in and changed storyline/dialogue. It's cool, but is much different than actual zombies and is not attractive. It is boring to be honest, you'd have to see this one for yourself. Freerun is cool but singleplayer. You are timed to reach the end of a challenging parkour course to try to best yourself and friends. There are different parkour courses, each getting harder as you go.  Overall this game gets a 7/10 from me :)

So, a new CoD game. This year it is Call of Duty Black Ops III. I'll be going over some categories in this review. And those categories will be the following: Campaign, Zombies and Multiplayer.   Campaign: I've been playing the campaign for a while now and I must say that it's a very ''Treyarch'' kind of campaign. Just how I like it! Full of customizable features such as Create-a-class in campaign, shared classes and the possibility of chosing which ability you wish to play with. Overall the missions are fun to play, especially with friends. The all new Realistic difficulty is actually really fun as well. So in my opinion this game is a great succes for Treyarch.  Multiplayer: Oh boy, we've arrived at the multiplayer. At this point I can finally say that i've achieved Prestige Master. So I think that i'm a position to review this section of the game. Anyways, multiplayer was and still is a great and fun experience for me.   Ups and Downs  Ups:  - Great dynamic maps in terms of making use of the new thrust jump ands wallrunning mechanics. - Neat weapon arsenal. Maybe a bit small but still okay, - Season pass content and modding tools are about to broaden content - Awesome and addictive challenges - Ofcourse emblem making had to be here XD. - Great support from Treyarch both in terms of patching and features like XP x 2 and Double Cryptokeys together with Liquid Diviniums.  Downs:  - Earning some weapons through supply drops. I'd like to state that it is fairly possible to get them through commons though. - Brecci and PO-6 sniper are insanely overpowered. And i'm not the type to quickly judge this, but these weapons are really OP. Not joking one bit. - Although I have Nuk3Town, it should be possible to everyone. I mean why not charge like €2,99 or something???  Zombies:   My favourite game mode in Call of Duty so far. But i'm sad to say this. Why? Well, I expected a bit more from zombies this year. But don't get me wrong, I don't dislike Black Ops III Zombies. I just thought that the previous games were a bit better in terms of replayability. For instance I really do like Shadows of Evil but I hate do all the rituals everytime to open the Pack a Punch. After a while it becomes kinda annoying. The Giant (Der Riese Remaster) on the other hand manages to amuse me a bit more. Also it's a pity we only get these few maps to play until DLC comes out. I wished they would have put more content in the game Zombie wise.  - UPDATE -  So I've observed this game for some time now and I'm ready to make some statements about the *New Stuff*  First off, I would like to mention the thing with the black market. So as we all know it is now possible to aquire weapons through supply drops.   UPS:  - New weapons hell yeah, more content basically.  - Adds more fun ways to kill your enemies.  DOWNS:  - Only a mere chance to get them in Rares not to mention the chance to get 'em in Normal drops. - Paid supply drops seem to be more efficiënt. (Even though it could still take hundreds of dollars)  Conclusion:  I think this game is definitely going the wrong way. I remember Treyarch clearly stating that they were against non-cosmetic stuff. This change however is solely Activisions choice as Treyarch had no partake in this decision.

TL:DR - Buy if you like COD, don't if you don't. Lots of people on PC will write-off this game - and that's a mistake. If you already have a hatred of this franchise, then yes, you won't like this game (For most of the Infinity Ward releases in particular, I'd hardly blame you!) Having said that, please give this game a fair chance. Zombies mode is pure awesome, and feels like the perfect continuation from BO2. The campaign, while full of cliché and very linear, is thouroughly enjoyable, especially because they added multi-player support to it. It almost made me fell like I was in a movie with the people I was playing with! The Multiplayer mode itself can also be good fun, as, unlike its predessesors, Treyarch have achieved good weapon balance and smooth mechanics with regards to movment and scorestreaks that, while not immersive as a 'realistic' FPS, still feels badass and refreshing. Graphics, while not Benchmark-grade, still look epic, and the appealing bright colors design motive is of great contrast to the dirt-filled, grimy enviroments that are typical to games like this. Mods are back, as is Steam Workshop support, which has been sadly lacking in this franchise and is allowing a whole new experience for COD on PC.  However, just like most games, it's not perfect. The RNG supply-drops, first intended to be cosmetic only (similar to CS:GO) are now an integral, expensive and annoying part of the game. Connections in Multiplayer are sometimes iffy (although, you might have Australia to thank for that), and aim-assist cheating is, unfortunatly, somewhat prevalent. Most of the time, though, BO3 is still a rewarding experience.

Ok Ok, this game is actually good.  I can't be mad anymore to this game. No, I just can't.   Treyarch finally listened and removed every trace of PlayStation icons on this version which was my last thing to complain about.  This game feels like CoD, movement has been increased even more than on AW, IMO this creates a learning curve even if you are expereienced in this series, killing player who are in the middle of the air is now trickier than ever.  Weapons are really good, for the most part because you can't have a game with this massive number of weapons and have everyone happy, you'll like some weapons and you won't tolerate others. In general I like all the guns in this game, unlike previous CoD's were I used to HATE certain weapons.  Graphics are good but unimpressive and even while this game is not unplayable, it feels like they could have optimized it more for it to take advantage of modern pc hardware. Shout out to the face models, they look fantastic and the cinematics are very well directed.  Level design is a bit lazy in the campaign (although this is exactly the opposite for MP) and in a very CoD fashion, the campaign is very linear and scripted so at the end of the day it is like this: run to b from a, stand behind these pillars and kill the targets, move on, breach this, kill those guys in slow-mo, go to the room, get the thingy and scape, etc. BUT!, some enemies are very well designed, some areas in the game are very difficult in veteran and just plain insane at realistic difficulty.   MP is very intense, in the level of previous games and sometimes more but killstreaks need to take some inspirtaion from early CoD games, here, some feel 'meh'.  Zombies is a great mode for playing it with friends and can get pretty intense and the old school feeling is very welcomed.  There are a couple extra game modes but they are not the main events so I'll limit myself to say they are ok but not something I return to very often.  Lastly, even if you don't like this franchise or the way the MP works in this FPS or even technical aspects of it like the graphics, you can't deny the enormous amount of stuff this game is filled with. There are TONS of game modes and TONS of unlockeables, this game has kept me playing for more than 300 hours which is almost the same as GTA V and it might even rival Skyrim some time in the summer and for that kind of value, this is a great game.  PD: People in MP play in the same modes over and over so if you want to exclusively buy this for let's say, gun game, this is NOT the game for you. Heck, DLC1 map playlists usually have about 1% of the total players for the game, sometimes 0%. Be warned.

If you have any friends that are willing to purchase this along with you then let me tell you this game is a must buy. With a friend this game is a blast, it feels so rewarding destroying the enemy team with your friend and then brag to your friend about how much better you did. We've played for over 70 hours and it's still interesting trying to find new strats and new ways to flank the enemy on every map. It's not exactly team based, but you could make it work (although 99% of the time me and my friend end up going our own way).   As expected the gameplay is fast and unforgiving, if you make the wrong move or switch weapon at an inopportune time expect to get killed. if the opposite happens and you opponent is the one caught making the wrong move, expect TO get the kill. scorestreaks are trash, you're best off getting something like an rc-hd or a dart because anything autonomous is going to get shot down with the broken blackhat in under 2 seconds every...single...time. If you play hardcore like me, just forget using the UAV. It's good in theory, but the enemy hearing 'UAV inbound' is like an invitation to the playboy mansion, i swear they get horny when they hear it. every teammate on that team with pull out that blackhat or switch to a class that has it and blow that uav up in record breaking time. They did release an update making it 'stronger' whatever that means, I'm sure one rocket is going to blow it up, you just can't cheese it by shooting it with a sniper 7 times.   Enough complaining, what does this game do well you ask? Well for one I actually like the addition of the cryptokeys and the black market. Yes I know, I know, microtransactions are bad mmkay (Don't act like you did not expect it though) but I think it's done very well. Unlike other games you can actually earn them, try earning a key in CS:GO. That's right, you can't, you're going to have to shell out 2.50. now the fact you can buy these crates seems rediculous to me, I can honestly say I don't think many people are going to do it. I think it was 2 bucks for a rare case, yeah right, it's not even like it takes that long to get them so I'm not complaining.   Now, the games guns are fairly well balanced, at least in hardcore mode i found. I don't play much of the normal modes, I used to but I have forgotten all I know of that in favour of the hardcore mode. What I found was a neat mix of some weapons that fire slow but could kill in 1 hit, and then some that fired very fast and killing in 2 hits. I find that to be pretty good and works well around people play styles. that's not to say it's perfect though, I've tested a lot of weapons and so far havent really found any completely unplayable. Never tested the pistols out, but that's most likely because their garbage, i would personally never waste a slot to use them.   On to the perks, they're alright. The only ones I find useful are basically the equivalent of quickdraw (i think it was fast hands or something, I don't remember) and gung ho. afterburner or whatever it's called where your jetpack refuels faster is useful as well, but what i find is I favour an extra attachment over this perk. That's the thing, being able to relinquish all perks for 5 attachments makes your weapon feel extremely powerful with yourself feeling weak. I'm more of a run and gun player so what I find is that I like to take off my sight (if the gun really doesn't need it, some really do as they have horrible iron sights) and put on the quickdraw like perk just because being able to aim fast after sprinting is extremely important. all the other perks like engineer, blind eye, etc. I find just completely useless with the exception of tracker if I can fit it into my build just because it can be very helpful. The reason being I find the others useless is because they have a prerequisite of having to have one of the useless killstreaks in the sky. blind eye makes you undetectable by I think all enemy aircraft. well guess what, they enemy aircraft is going to get show down in 10 seconds, I think I can wait.   Sorry for the rant, now on to the bad (as if killstreaks weren't enough, but I'll admit, some are good). The campaign, I bet you saw this one coming. The campaign is just what it's like in all call of duty games, run around and shoot what you're told to shoot. but I found the campaign even when playing with a friend was extremely boring. It took me and my buddy maybe 6 hours to complete and it is completely forgettable, i faintly remember something called a DNI interface we did to almost everyone in the ♥♥♥♥ing campaign. my friend and I would always make fun of the amount of buzzwords they try to use, like mainframe, DNI (I actually forgot what it stands for), hack, etc.. I think it's cool that they let you make custom classes for the campaign but I feel it would be too tedious to get those singleplayer campaign camos for the guns in multiplayer, i feel like nobody does that. I, like i bet many people including my friend, used the same weapon throughout the campaign just because you get unlockes for it. and it's unlikely you're going to get all the unlocks throughout the campaign so you're best off just using that gun. All in all, the campaign is a mess, it seems uninspired and all around just a bore to play through.   notice how I have not touched upon zombies mode yet? well, that's because in honesty I've played very little of it. it's cool and all, but it's just so complicated in this recent game that I have no idea what i'm supposed to do. Should I collect those golden things i found one time? should I open that teleporter thing that teleports you in some tran station, should I become the beast? what even is the beast? why am I vsing zombies? is it because I'm a criminal? is there an end game to this? I just find it frusterating. All i want to do is kick zombie ♥♥♥, turn on the power, and packapunch my damn weapon, it that so hard? Before you say anything yes I know I can get the old zombie map which I would love. Here's what i don't love, having to buy their ♥♥♥♥♥♥ overpriced season pass for their game. I hate the idea that i have to purchase something I don't even know whats going to come inside. Yeah, 4 map packs, but what if they're all bad? just not a fan, I would LOVE to try out the other zombie map but i can't. feels a bit cheap to give me one zombie map and if I don't like it, i won't even touch the gamemode you worked so long and hard on.   that brings me to something though, map design is great in multiplayer. I love the amount of options you have to flank your enemy. It makes camping a lot harder and I wish more people would just play kill confirmed, hardcore and regular tdm is FULL of USELESS campers hiding around EVERY corner waiting for you to walk by, so annoying. I forgot what cod had this mechanic, but I faintly remember that in one cod if someone stood still for an extended period of time I think they showed up on the minimap. Would love that in this game, would complete the experience no doubt. Campers are the reason I hate TDM, how can you even have fun playing like that??? oh well, people like different things I suppose.  On to performance, the game in my experience runs very well. I play on a desktop with a GTX 780, 8gb's of ram, and an i5-4670k and the game runs buttery smooth with no frame drops. The addition of a FOV slider is also very welcomed.  Finally, Treyarch, FIX THE MATCHMAKING AS SOON AS IS HUMANLY POSSIBLE! it's always a gamble whether or not i can join my friends lobby or he can join mine. I'm sure this has happened to someone else, it cannot just be me and my friend. I would say OVER 80% of the time I will get the message: ERROR, LOBBY NOT JOINABLE for no apparent reason. Our nat's are on moderate, party size set to the highest, restarting the game on both ends does not rectify it, so I'm only left to assume it's a server side issue.   in conclusion, if you're on the fence about it, just buy it.

Since I played the free weekend I guess I get to write a review for this. I play this game on PS4, and on there at least, it's a really good game. Framerate is consistent, story is surprisingly deep, multiplayer has deep customization, zombies has great puzzle and exploration mechanics, and there's a second campaign for free.  Some cons are that the multiplayer maps are filled with camping/headglitch spots, making the whole enhanced movement thing kinda mute, and the twist to the story is something you may never even know about because instead of putting it in the actual story, Treyarch bizzarely hides it in fast-scrolling text. Besides those issues though, I enjoy this game. It's one of, if not the most content-filled CoD game to date, and the multiplayer is some of the most balanced a CoD game has ever been (Besides those freaking flashbangs GRRRR I hate those).   All in all, this game has good stuff for everybody. Do you like a pretty good-sized story that loves to screw with your head? Well you've got two. Do you like a fun multiplayer romp that has great weapon variety, great modes (As well as safeguard, literally one of the best modes in the CoD franchise to date), and good replay value in the form of unlockable skins, calling cards and more? You've got multiplayer, with enough unlockable skins, achievements, camos, ADS reticle designs, optional challenges, modes, etc. to last you a very long time. Just wanna play zombies with friends? You can totally do that, along with the option of going much deeper down the rabbit hole and solving all the mysteries the new map presents.  8.5/10 +Great amount of content +Extra depth added to Campaign, Multiplayer and Zombies +No ASM1 nor Bal +Great story that loves screwing with you (Just look up the twist ending after beating it, it'll make so much more sense) +A second campaign made out of reshuffled levels from the first (Still a lot of fun, and surprisingly not sold as Day 1 DLC) -Too many camp spots in multiplayer

Used to be an avid COD player. Game battles and tourneys, the whole nine yards. I stopped towards the end of ghost and played 7 hrs of AW and wrote the franchise off. It was apparently buggy for some, but if you have a PC and aren't intuitive enough to google settings fixes or tinker yourself than you should be on a console. The game runs smooth as butter and looks awesome. Movement is good and they're aren't crazy weapon advantages early in the game like most other cod titles. Definitely worth it.

Finally! A decent COD game. The past couple games have been complete flops. Treyarch seems to be the only developer to get it mostly right, and care about the community. Shout out to PCDEV for getting the ball rolling quickly on issues the PC community have. The multiplayer aspect is a lot of fun, albiet can be frustrating at times. How To Make a Basic Butter Cake from Scratch  Makes one 2-layer cake What You Need Ingredients 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened (plus extra for greasing the pans) 1 1/2 cups sugar 3 large eggs 2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour 1 teaspoon salt 3 1/2 teaspoons baking powder 1 1/4 cups whole milk 1 teaspoon vanilla 2 1/2 cups buttercream frosting, such as basic buttercream  Equipment 2 9-inch round pans Stand mixer or hand mixer Measuring cups and spoons Cookie scoop or measuring cup, for dividing the batter  Instructions Heat the oven to 350°F. Sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside. Prepare the pans: Rub the bottoms and sides of the cake pans with a little butter, shortening, or baking spray. Make sure to get into the corners and all the way up the sides. Flour the sides and bottoms of the pan by scooping a bit of flour into the pan, then shaking and tapping to coat the bottom and sides of the pan with flour; dump out the excess. Alternatively, cut out a parchment round and use this to line the bottom. Beat the butter and sugar until fluffy and light. Cream together for about 3 to 5 minutes on medium spread (see above notes for more information). Add the eggs one at a time. Beat until the batter is very smooth and creamy-looking. Adding the eggs one at a time gives them a better chance at incorporating into a smooth batter. Be sure they are room temperature so the batter does not appear curdled. Beat in half the flour, salt, and baking powder. Add the sifted dry ingredients with the mixer running at low speed. Continue to mix until incorporated. Beat in the milk and vanilla. Alternate adding in the liquids with the dry ingredients so the milk has a chance to be absorbed without needing to overmix the batter. Stream in the milk with the mixer on low until combined. Beat in the remaining flour mixture until just combined and no more visible flour remains. Stir a few times with a spatula to make sure no more flour remains on the bottom of the bowl. Divide the batter between cake pans. Use a scale or mechanical ice cream scoop to evenly divide the batter. Smooth the tops with an offset spatula. Drop the pans against the counter to shake out air bubbles. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes: When done, the cake should be puffed like a pillow, golden, and pull away from the sides of the pan. When done, a toothpick inserted into the center of the cakes should come out clean. Cool for 15 minutes in the pan. Run an offset spatula around the cake to make sure it's completely loosened from the sides of the pan. Flip the rounds out of the pan, remove the parchment lining, and flip right-side up to cool completely. Once cool, frost and assemble the cake with the buttercream.

Call of Duty: Black Ops III has been a game that I've been waiting for over Three years. So let's talk about The Good, The Bad &The Ugly.   The Good:  -The game runs smooth for me, and I never loss more then 150FPS. I currently have it cap'd at 150 since I have a 144Hz Monitor. The games FPS can go up to 0-1000 and un-cap'd I get around 180-200+ ( On Ultra )  - I love zombies, and I'm a huge zombies fanatic and have been playing it since release ( currently #1 ). Saying that I will tell you how zombies is. I love how you can put on attachments on you're weapons and even camos, etc AND use them in zombies. Not just in Multiplayer. What I mean by attachments is that you can have one optic and up to five actual attachments. Zombies is very very smooth for me and I'm enjoying it a lot.  - I love that you can customize you're settings fully as of in: FPS cap, FOV 65-120, Advanced, Hz, Res, mouse acceleration, etc. It is much better and more improved from Call of Duty: Black Ops II. They really made this game PC Friendly in the settings department.  - Love the leveling system in Zombies. I can now get to a prestige and enjoy ranking up even more! The max rank is currently 1-35 and let me tell you. Getting to 35 is not as easy as you think. Basically it's a lot better then just being Shoutguns in Black Ops II. Now if you see someone who is a high rank / prestige you are going to know that that person has been playing for a while and that he is experienced and can carry the team on his back!  -The weapons are awesome, and I love the sound of them when they shoot, as well as shooting when Pack-A-Punched.  Adding more weapons in DLCs like AW did would be a very good idea as well.  -The graphics and textures look amazing on the new engine! Now saying this I don't mean that they look better then Battlefield 4, but they are almost as good as Frostbite Engine. Now I have to give it to the designers, they did a great job! So I had originally written a joke review about the game, but I feel like I should write a proper review.  In the beginning the game was alright, there was a couple preformance issues that were fixed. Then one day they added supply drops. It was still a great game, cosmetics only in supply drop that you HAVE to earn. But Treyarch added in cod points, which is where you can pay real money for cosmetic items. It was fine, no one HAD to buy cod points to do well, they only had to buy them if they wanted to look cool. But Treyarch saw that they were not making as much money as advanced warfare. So they decided to add some reskins of the combat knife. *The wrench*. But still, no one was buying them, so Treyarch decided to go back on their promise and add new weapons that were overpowered. Now multiplayer is broken. People will just rush someone with a new weapon so they can grab it, then when they have it they just camp so they can use it more because they know that they might not play with it another day. The campaign is not very fun, and I don't even know what 'Nightmares' is. The new zombies map is complicated, I am one of those zombie players that enjoys a laid back map like town from bo2. The upgraded bows are really hard to obtain and there are a lot of jerks that won't buy any doors. I know that Treyarch can't fix that but it's still annoying. I honestly might not buy the next call of duty knowing that another one will just come out a year later. I wish they didn't come out every year because you are basically paying 80 bucks *CAD* to play a game for a year. Unless Treyarch makes an AMAZING zombie map that isn't complicated and is fun, my review will stay the same.

another year, another cod, another couple hundread people buying the game and then instantly complaining. personally i have no idea why so many people would buy a game they hate every single year, thus funding more games but that is just me. so many of the negative reviews are 10 word lines 'lol cod sucks' or 'man this brand new game has bugs 0/10' and i get it, hating cod is a meme so it does not matter what the game does right, one thing bad and you instantly get mad.  This cod changes up the movement style of AW with less rocket boosting and more wall running and parkour, it also adds a very simple class system in the form of specialists which give you one really strong ability, like seeing though walls for a couple seconds at a time to a flamthrower of doom, the multiplayer maps are cool for the most part with plently of high and low roads that use the new parkour and all the best gamemodes are back.  The campaign in cod has never been the focus but i like the changes done here, getting to pick a few faces and then later on change your armor, helments and the like is nice, after each mission you also return to a safehouse where you can create your own loadout, your cyber abilitys, review score and train. alltogether that alone makes this a bit different than most of the other cods where you just ran from place to place shooting everything with preset weapons.  Zombies, ah zombies, personally not my thing but i love the style here, going for a lovecraftian mix with a bit of 50s gangstas is very fun to see and the new non-zombie mobs keep things fresh, from giant bees to tentancle monsters.   The game has a few bugs because it is new and the I5 cards have a lot of problems but i am not going to write a REVIEW on a game that says 'my game is not at 60fps 0/10' because that would be very silly, personally i have got 60fps and nearly all time and my big issue was my sound was no working, a restart did fix this.  overall this game adds a lot of new stuff, some refreshing twists and is cod, the silly mlg game that you can plug in and play without a care in the world, might want to wait a while for the bugs and I5 problems to be fixed if you have an intel card or if you have not a lot of money a sale but this is a decent game.

I'm not the review-writing type and I was very worried when I saw the negative reviews. Consulting friends, I found out the performance issues where a thing if you haven't upgraded your GFX card drivers; Once you do, it runs fine.  I bought the game, the game warned me about my outdated GFX card drivers, I upgraded my GFX card drivers and the game runs fine.  There are some considerations; Some GFX settings are very demanding even on the most powerful setups. Lowering volumetric lightning and ambient occlusion (or whatever these are called) will make great changes to the performance.  At this moment, I run the game at 60-80fps at 80% resolution scale with UHD resolution. In addition, I turned down volumetric lightning down a notch to reduce some massive framedrops for some scenes.  I use a 980TI, 8GB RAM and a non-K i5 4670.  The Zombies-mode is beautiful & fun, but boy, it's expensive if you want both the Der Riese remake & the 'standard' weird map. IMO, the Der Riese remake is more fun than the weird map. Positive.  + Wall running/thruster pack. This is very different to the EXO suit and reminds me more of TitanFall.  +Linked to the above, there is a very different movement system to previous titles. It is much better than COD Advanced Warfare in the sense that the gun fights tend to take place on the ground rather than in the air. You are not jumping miles and miles into the air to shoot people. It is more like the COD of old in this sense (however that is not to say that you can’t do some cool moves like flip off the wall and shoot the s**t out of someone on the way down!). The movement is still 3D, but the developers have taken into account the way our brain works. We don’t want to be looking up and down, which is a pain in the a**e, we look from right to left, the game plays in this style and allows for a smoother, more fun experience.  +You can practice your skills in the free running mode. If you want to be a boss player like me, then you can complete all four (I think) courses. These courses increase in difficulty as you progress. An example of this is when, on one of the later courses, you have to wall run on glass, if you don’t land on the glass right, it smashes and you fall, its game over dude.  +There is great character customisation; you can change a lot more things, head, chest, camo. You can now also be a female, allowing you to portray your feminine side. I tend to use this option on a Saturday night when I call myself Queen Barbara. But seriously, this is definitely a good move, and allows for more diversity in the game. Anything different in this manner, in my books, is great.  +It’s made by Treyarch, who, for me are the better COD developers in recent years.  +There is a ‘PowerTree’ play style on campaign that allows you to choose your skills, which in a sense is a skill in itself. You really have to focus on what you are choosing to get the best advantage on the field. In this sense the game is tactical and make you think of your own playing style and what works best for you. Personally I like to take out as many enemies as possible, while looking them in right in the eye. My favourite ability is the power punch where you can take out a load of the suckers close range - kind of like a human grenade, but no explosion! It reminds me of a WWE finisher. +The campaign is great. I enjoyed the Advanced Warfare campaign, but so far, and I have not completed it yet, I am enjoying this more. COD, for many years has been more about the multiplayer than the campaign, but the stories still matter to me, and I like a good, well scripted, thought-out motion picturesque game, with unique ideas – however I don’t just want to play an interactive movie.  +The graphics are great and are polished NEXT GEN style. The game is a beauty on the eye, it is colourful, vibrant and crisp. It is so easy to distinguish objects and people. With customisation, everything looks unique. For me, this makes the game feel more immersive.  +The kill streaks seem easier to earn. They are much like previous titles. They are none upgradable, and none swappable for perks – something that used to p*ss me off. It is refreshing to see this has reverted to how it used to be. +There are better spawn points. Not very often did I spawn in a bad place. I die a lot so this is definitely a good thing! +It is a lot harder to snipe. The sensitivity of the weapon changes as you scope. There is no autoaim and NO QUICKSCOPE!!!   +The game features mind control – NANO bees FTW. This, IMO, is the way warfare is going, even today there is mind control, however subtle it may be. This game is looking into the future and showing you what your kids, kids will be doing.  +Mods coming in 2016 - The main reason I bought this for PC and not PS4!  ZOMBIES IS BACK ,which is one of the main reasons I have bought this game.  +Zombies has its own progression style system. You can think tactics and customise your arsenal before the game has started.   +From what I have played, I can see that the game seems to encourage more cooperation than on previous titles, if you want to progress to those higher rounds, there will be no ‘every man for himself’ attitude.  +Zombies is set in the 1940s fictional Bork City, Jeff Goldblum is one of the main characters. He plays a magician and his dialogue is hilarious as he turns into a BEAST that literally rips zombies apart.  Negative.  -Maps are larger than Black Op2 (positive), but they feel a lot smaller due to the new ways of movement. It is quicker to traverse the map making the battle field seem pretty small.  -There are loads of perks that make things unfair – things such as sixth sense, which shows on the map when someone is approaching you from behind. You can see through walls with one ability, this takes away any element of surprise. One ability allows you to see an enemies footprints so you can follow him and kill him (this is somewhat more acceptable.) The worst one is ‘psychosis’ which is basically a way of the developers not being able to fix the lag problems, so they make lag an ability.  -Not many people will play the classic, hard core, barebones; original COD style gameplay, which is a bit of a shame, because there are so many things in this that is missing from the new titles, including this one. The game developers obviously need to change a game and make it feel more refreshing, however don’t try to fix things that are not broken – this has been the general evolution of the series though, not just this game.  - I’m crap and tend to get shot A LOT. Sometimes it doesn’t feel like a lack of skill though, but probably due to OP abilities and weapons – for example some of the weapons are aweful and take ages to kill anyone, whilst others are more realistic and take an acceptable amount of use to kill a foe.  -the movement, although better than Advanced Warfare, can still feel ‘clunky’. If you bump into a teammate whilst wall running, you will fall, and 9/10 you will die a painful death.  -no fully customisable controls, it would be great to have a ARMA 3 style control option so you can feel more comfortable whilst playing.  -no supply drops, I used to love the gamble of what I was going to get. It added variety to the game. I’m all about variety.  -It is very difficult to match make with friends due to server matching and lag. Something they should have sorted out from previous titles. Whilst on the subject of lag… in fact don’t get me started. I’ll mention two words: lag compensation.  Overall I would recommend buying this game. It is good, and you can see the developers are trying to make something different and new, whilst catering to a large global audience, all with varying tastes. My review is obviously my own opinion, and some of the points I have put across as positive may be negative for others, as well as vice versa. At the end of the day, playing the game was fun, and I think it was worth the money I paid. The longevity of the game, I am not sure of, isn’t Star Wars Battle Front out soon?

The stuttering seems to be a result of vram overusage.   How to fix:  Go to the Players folder in the BO3 folder (SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\Call of Duty Black Ops III\players)  Open the config file with any text editor you'd like  Change find and change the following values to the ones listed here:  //Fraction of video memory usage to target  VideoMemory = '0.8' // 0.75 to 1  //Enable volumetric sun and light shafts  VolumetricLightingEnabled = '0' // 0 or 1  4 Click save and quit the text editor.  5 Have fun and share this to other people who have the same problems :D   Credits: fnt4prez, reddit.

Latest Edit:  Now they removed Nuk3town only? ♥♥♥♥. ================ After seeing all the negative reviews, I feel urged to write a review of my own.  A friend and I played this from the moment it launched (midnight) until 9:00 in the morning just because the campaign is so addictive and multiplayer is so much fun.  For the record, I hated Advanced Warfare and Ghost, and I'm a Battlefield fanboy. But this is the best CoD in a few years. Good Job Treyarch.  Campaign: Pros - Coop, and it's addictive. - In-depth weapon and ability customization. - It's difficult. No more shooting paper people, enemy type and combination can be REALLY hard for you. - The story is actually good. It's not perfect, but it feels like Ex Machina, instead of MICHEEEEEEEAL BAAAAAAAAY all the way through. - Gore. Treyarch has gone so far to bring us a world that explosives and droids mean business. Limb business. - The chapters are full of surprises and wtf moments that only Treyarch and its Black Ops series can imagine.  Cons - Not long enough. - Lack of character development. - Bad voice acting.  Multiplayer Pros -  This multiplayer is actually fun.  It feels right, and it feels addictive. It actually reminds me of Black Ops I, and even Modern Warfare I & II multiplayer. It just fefels right. -  No more flying around.  I know you can wall-run and jet-packing, but that's just traveling around the map in this game. It gives you big disadvantage that you just want to stay on the ground when shooting. -  Powerful specialist ability.  -  Gorgeous Graphics.  Man, I really didn't know that I would say this to a CoD game, but it's really colorful and pretty. -  Nuk3town is back again!  -  Modding tools, map editor, and custom servers coming soon! (2016)    Cons - Nuk3town is not available for everyone. - Escorting Robot mode is broken. For a CoD game, BO3 has a great multiplayer that meets my expectation. It's no battlefield, no CSGO, it's just CoD.  If you are looking to buy a fast-paced, fun to play, solid 3A title, this is it.

I'll get the bad out first:  Coming from someone who understands the process of building software, it is MIND-BOGGLING how many completely absurd bugs made it into the release version of this supposed 'AAA Action Title' for the PC platform.  Lets list just a few:  1) The game often starts in Windowed mode, despite it being in Fullscreen mode before it was last closed.  2) Whenever you alt-tab out of Fullscreen mode, the game automatically changes to Windowed mode. This one particularly sucks because you have to then go into the settings panel and change it back to Fullscreen before resuming play.  3) After every match, without a single exception at least for me, my monitor blue-screens for about 5 seconds before the post-match results / score screen pops up. Wtf?  4) This one might be too terrible to be considered a bug, instead I might describe it as 'one of the most idiotic design and implementation choices a team of software developers could possibly make'. This horrible thing I speak of is that the player's sensitivity is tied to the frames per second. . . What does this mean, you might ask? In short, it means that if your frame rate varies at all (Literally every PC game has a fluctuating frame rate due to the nature of PC games), your sensitivity will change synchronously with the frame rate itself. This one is especially bad for those who might have lower end machines, as they will likely experience a game breaking variation in sens that renders them unable to aim better than even the dirtiest of console peasant potatoes.  5) Piggy-backing off of #4, I find the optimization of this game to be questionable at best. When at full resolution, with all settings maxed out, I will admit, the game does look pretty nice. Animations in particular look great and the overall art design is a pleasure to take in. However, this game does not light a candle to the sheer brevity, scale, and technical graphical capabilities of Battlefield 4, a 2+ year old game mind you. The kicker is that my frames, on a map that makes the largest BO3 map look like the size of a ♥♥♥♥ing pantry, on BF4 is HIGHER than what I get on a typical BO3 map which is ♥♥♥♥ing CRAZY.  6) The last one has been slightly fixed but is still a glaring issue that ultimately will have to be completely remedied. The overall controls in general just don't feel great. Initially when the game released, it was not even possible to play at full resolution scale without massive input lag. Recently this seems to be slightly fixed, as I have been able to now set my resolution scale to 100% and still play without serious control issues, but again there is still some sluggishness to the controls that needs ironing out.  Congratulations, you did it, you made it through my huge rant about the technical problems of this game. There isn't much else to say to be honest. Ignoring all the aforementioned problems, the actual 'game' itself is ♥♥♥♥ing dope. Wall running, improved player / weapon customization, plethora of game modes, zombies, campaign, co-op, etc are all awesome and generally build upon the successful formula that CoD has employed over the last iterations to great success.  In its current state, I do not recommend the game, however I have strong faith that all the problems with the PC version will be fixed with due time. In the event that they are, I will update this review to reflect such a change in opinion. Peace.

Campaign: There is no attachment to the characters (at least for me). The story is very confusing near the end of the game. There is a progression system, where you can earn accolades but these dont give you anything apart from braggin rights. There were some references to the previous call of duty's, which I found pretty cool, but there are no characters related to the ones in previous games. On the other hand, there is co-op campaign now which is really fun with friends.  Multiplayer: Bunch of soldiers jumping around like ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, camping with railgun snipers (Drakon), spamming shotguns and camping in corners. The new specialist system was actually pretty cool at the start, however now I just stick to one since there is not much point in playing as multiple ones, unless you're going for the hero outfits which require you to complete all challenges on all specialists. Furthermore, Treyarch added new weapons in the recent update, which you have to unlock by farming Cryptokeys and opening cases. However, these usually give you really bad looking camos, gestures, clan tags, and basically anything apart from what you want, unless you have hundreds of dollars to spend on cases.  Zombies: Very fun, but takes some getting used to since the zombies can get really fast. There is an awesome progression system, which is very rewarding. Also there's a new boss enemy, cool new wonder weapon, cool new replacement for monkeys which is an octopus in a jar, and awesome pack-a-punch weapons which look and sound amazing. However, to actually get to the pack-a-punch, you have to do 4 rituals in each area of the map which takes a lot of points and time, therefore getting set-up can take some time. Also, if you pre order the game or buy the season pass, you get a remake of Der Riese called 'The Giant'. The Giant keeps all the things that the fans loved in der riese, but it looks 10x better. UPDATE----10 FEB  Ever since the last update, I have not been able to play this game anymore. I am getting the unable to connect to the server issue. I've tried all of the troubleshooting I can find and nothing has worked for it.      Overall: the game is a much better call of duty than what we have had in a while. That being said, it definitely has its flaws.  Coming from a 980 Ti, I still experience frame rate drops from a solid 60 FPS down to 24 FPS in certain areas of the multiplayer maps. I am forced to play at a mere 1080p with all settings set to their the maximum except the volumetric lighting, which is set to medium. I should be able to play this game at a 1440p resolution with maxed out graphical options while maintaining a solid frame rate, yet I do not. 24 FPS is game breaking for call of duty. A bug that I have noticed as well is anytime I tab switch back to my desktop, the game window switches from full-screen mode to windowed mode and I have to go back into the graphical settings and change the option back. Hopefully a driver update or a game patch will remedy this frame rate stutter very soon.  As of the launch date, the Haymaker-12 shotgun is overpowered due to the flinch mechanic that Black Ops 3 has. It is almost impossible to be able to shoot back with any sort of accuracy against someone who is using this gun against you, yet it takes three to four rounds from the shotgun to kill you, they might as well have made this shotgun a two shot kill. Either the flinch mechanic needs to be removed from the PC version of the game, or this shotgun needs a humongous nerf in its affective range.  As for the rest of the weapons, I simply haven’t unlocked many of them yet. It feels like once you have hit level ten or so, there is a larger gap between when you unlock the next weapon, I am not entirely happy with the ones I am stuck using. The lower level tiered weapons seem to fall shadow to those players who have played longer and have unlocked their higher leveled weapons. For anyone worried about quick-scoping, it is exactly how I remember Black Ops 2 having their sniper rifle mechanic.   The specials system, in my opinion are a way to allow younger children an edge for those who wish not to use this handicap. I would have preferred this weapons and abilities to not have been in the ranked multiplayer aspect of the game. Of course, removing them won’t happen, so I would like to see a lobby added that has most of the game modes such as team death match, search and destroy, kill confirmed, demolition, and domination, but disables the specialist weapons/abilities.  As for the Campaign, it’s like any other Call of Duty campaign. It’s neither rememberable, nor is it too terrible. I have yet to complete the campaign, and I am sure I eventually will, but it’s something to play when you need a break from the frustrating moments of the multiplayer aspect.  The zombies mode is interesting. Personally, Treyarch has turned its Zombies mode into quite the standalone. It has become way too complex for me to understand what I need to do without looking up walkthrough videos as to what I need to do to progress the story other than surviving the waves of zombie hordes. I miss the simplicity of the World at War original zombies map. However, it is still quite fun to play and escape from the forget campaign mode, and the frustrating multiplayer mode.  In closing, I can easily recommend purchasing the game. It is quite a nice refresh from the previous flops of Call of Duty games. But when are they going to take the hint and stop giving us these future mech-suit assisted games?! We are tired of this type of shooter. I am definitely ready to return the roots of the Call of Duty series and play a next-gen World War genre game. Before you buy the game on Steam and pay full price, check ♥♥♥ first, or wait for a steam sale or bundle. This game would definitely be worth your time if you pay less than forty-five dollars.  May your frame rates be mighty, and your draw distance far.  UPDATE -------------------  I just noticed that I cannot change my emblem or calling card. They always revert back to the default once I exit the menu. It's quite frustrating.

Where to start.. Well, After playing a bit of almost all the modes, except nightmares, I do indeed like this game and think its an okay touch-up from Black Ops 3. But, after drudging through the campaign with frame drops and stutters from hell, I find it to be a good story, but the PC optimization for this game is so bad that I've read that even people with 'Super Rigs' have trouble with the stuttering and freezing. I feel like they should have figured a fix for these issues, even after almost a year after release, which shows how much they care for their PC fanbase. Multiplayer and Zombies I don't have that many problems with, but it can still be jittery. I have a PC capable of Maxing out this and other games, but no matter the settings, it will still have its moments where it acts like it wants to crash. After manually changing a number in a file (which I should not have to, c'mon Treyarch), the multiplayer and zombies gamemodes run better than before. With the addition of the workshop, it is nice to see fan made creations playable, and that is really the only reason to get this game for PC. If you don't really care for that and only want the base game and its DLC, buy it on PS4 or XBONE, as I've seen smoother gameplay for those systems.  Also, I know you don't have to buy any of the Black Market crap, but hiding content behind a paywall, of a RANDOMIZED supply drop, is a pretty weak move for a (IMO) dying franchise. But you know, if you want to spend money for that cool looking weapon skin or exclusive weapon, go right ahead.   All in All: 5/10 - Needs better ports and less 'pay for cod points' crap and instead should offer challenges to unlock special stuff.

Black Ops 3 is possibly one of the best FPS games I've played in a long time, it's that good.   Pros : -Campaign is great, the story is somewhat different from previous installments and it's co-op too. There is also customisation and a leveling up system which makes it more interesting to play. -Multiplayer has always been the highlight of COD and this one doesn't disappoint. There are now characters with special 'MOBA' like abilities which make matches more interesting. Map design is also much better in this game (basically, all maps follow a similar design pattern of mid lane, left lane and right lane like a MOBA). The weapons are mostly balanced which is good. -Zombies is amazing this time round, the Shadows of Evil map is possibly one of the best maps I've played in quite a while (I've played all zombie maps on all COD games). There is also new systems in place such as Gobblegums and weapon kits which makes zombies feel more addictive. -Mod support is now out, there are lots of great zombie and multiplayer maps that you can download and play right now. The kit has only been out for a month but I can't wait to see what they do. -Presentation wise, the game looks great with amazing facial animations and all that. The sound design is also pretty neat.   Cons : -PC Port issues : Performance is mostly good on this game but the game tends to have issues such as super high memory and video memory usage which could render the game unplayable depending on your system. -Business model : The game didn't launch with microtransactions but it has them now. And you can't buy the DLC separately which is a pain in the neck.  TL;DR Black Ops 3 is a fantastic Call Of Duty. It has lots of good content, great presentation, and mod support too. It's a shame that the game suffers from a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ publisher.

Just a little edit: I figured out how to fix the framerate drops via reddit. If you go to the folder titled Call Of Duty Black Ops III and then go to the players file and find the config.ini file, find the line //Fraction of video memory usage to target and change it to .75. The default value is .95. The higher the value the shorter the loading time, at the expense of framerate. The time difference is only like 3 seconds longer of loading screens.

This game is great, 9/10. Here's why: Campaign: I would say the downfall to this aspect is how the characters think that shooting robots is the only solution to anything, and that the missions can drag on for a very long time if you play it on hardened or higher. This drags my rating down, as the campaign is also very predictable. (It is extremely easy to guess when there will be an ambush, extremely cliché) Multiplayer: The multiplayer has considerably less screaming 12 year olds' in the lobbies, which is a massive plus and comes about due to the 18+ rating. It is also fun to play with friends, especially chaos moshpit. (except once nuketown has been voted in, it will continue to be nuketown). Multiplayer can get frustrating, but switching to the VMP or another SMG usually upps the k/d ratio. Zombies: This mode is great, especially with friends once again. I would personally recommend The Giant for a challenging game that reminds you of earlier titles, or Der Eisendrache for a more traditional game mode (no squid), but with a much easier map. Shadows of Evil is by far one of the hardest zombies maps, just because of all of the weird and challenging zombies that come running (or rolling) at you, and how confined it is. The pack-a-punch in SOE is also very hard to get if you don't understand what to do.  Overall, I would recommend buying this game, but be wary about the predictable campaign and its' long missions. 9/10

The single player campaign is a good shout for any FPS fan though.

I'm certainly not a fan of the franchise, although I've played every installment except for Ghosts. I can confidently say that this is the worst Call of Duty multiplayer experience yet. There are a number of glaring, objective issues which make this a frustrating game to play, as well as even more which are more subjective and make this an unpleasant experience for me (and others like me specifically). The game obviously has some improvements however, and those will be listed last.  Objective Faults -the worst servers yet, which is a nightmare when combined with the worst hit-detection I've seen in awhile -multiplayer matchmaking is completely unbalanced with no option for new players to go against people their own level, which wouldn't be too bad except the game has a slightly steeper learning curve and the weapons and specialists acquired at later levels are much more powerful, new players don't stand a chance -the game has gone full pay-2-win -small maps and increased player mobility has made the spawning system even more broken than its been in previous games, enemies will constantly come up behind your team (favouring overly-cautious teams)  Subjective Faults -the visuals are incredibly bland an boring, every weapon looks very similar -the game is over-saturated with one-hit kill weapons, which, while often requiring some skill, makes engagements much shorter or prevents them altogether, you will frequently have no chance to fight back -all the maps are pretty much the same in terms of size and shape, in what is likely an attempt at making many playstyles viable in every map (the result is that the same class can be used on every map and every game feels exactly like the one before it) -rather than just dealing with drop-shotting, you now have to contend with many other annoying tactics which other players employ, including sliding, thrusting, wall-running, and again, drop-shotting. In the proportionately few instances where two players meet face to face, the result is often a Halo-like contest of jumping around in circles (this enhanced movement is made much more aggravating by the poor hit-detection and quality of he servers) -the developers have abandoned all attempts at disguising the fact that their target audience is twelve-year-old children, the game is crammed with stale internet humour and memes, performed by characters who are supposedly war-hardened soldiers. If you had any residual respect for the series, the goofy and jarring 'humour' and tacky metal music that has replaced an otherwise straightforward concept will rob you of it. -it has become impossible to visually tell your own team apart from the enemy team without relying on HUD indicators because the same characters can be on both teams, albeit instead of team-consistent uniforms they now have fluorescent, gaudy outfits that you'd expect to see in a parade -the weapons are incredibly gimmicky, and even more of them are so silly that they'll make you shake your head in disappointment. A certain amount of whimsy and 'rule-of-cool' rationale has been present in most of the later games in the franchise, but this one has gone of the deep end. many players stick to flying around the map wielding pipe-wrenches and baseball bats, serving as a constant reminder that nobody is taking anything seriously (which is likely what fueled the downward slope of these games in the first place, seeing as how easily people forgive their mediocrity)  Improvements -the customization options have increased greatly, allowing players greater freedom in decking out their gear -while certainly silly, many of the specialist weapons and abilities are actually really cool -its not a bad game to look at

This iteration of COD does the same as what you would expect: it's more of the same, with a dash of wallrunning this time around. Is it worth $60 if you don't count the campaign? Not in its DLC-less state (not enough maps, maps are small-ish as usual). How do you solve this problem? By getting more maps. Well then, I'll simply download the maps off some custom maps site, right? Oh wait, that was the nineties. You have to shell out an additional $50 to beef the map pool and the saddest part of it all: this is the best deal as the Season Pass is a DISCOUNT price in contrast to the individual DLC packs. So that's $110 for this average gunk. And for those who are genuinely new to this PC/COD deal, it is important to know that these extra maps divide the player base. Take one guess where the majority of the players are. That's right... in the DLC-less player pool. So what does that mean? It means if you get the DLC maps you will suddenly have less people to play with, if at all. Right now, TDM is the only really popular mode, along with CTF and Domination way down the popularity pole.   Conclusion: Is this game worth $110 just so you can wait for lobbies to fill up? Nope. Forgo on DLC and 'only' pay $60 and run a very limited amount of maps? Doesn't sound like a plan. So what's left? There's a Multiplayer Starter Pack option that only gives you access to the multiplayer part (no campaign, no zombies) and this is the first time they actually gave us the option to pay as much as the (incomplete, DLC-less) product is worth: $15. So you can still enjoy the 'fun' that bad netcode has to offer, players shooting you down after you've passed corners even in replay, cookie cutter maps; the usual nonsense. At least I feel less dirty having paid $15 instead of $110 this time around. That, and the Specter specialist is keeping me entertained and making opponents curse me out on it. That's gotta count for something.  I recommend this game for the $15 price like I would recommend a MacDonalds happy meal to someone who wants to enjoy some greasy fast food. Because that's what this game is: mediocre fast food fps.

Ah, the infamous Call of Duty franchise. Love it or hate it, it is a classic formula to create a frantic and chaotic fun. As a port, I have had no issues so far, the game runs completely fine. Controls for mouse and keyboard work great, and when I plug in my Xbox controller it works just dandy as well. The campaign mode is... intriguing, although the ending is quite vague and confusing. The plot is extremely artistic, so while it may have you shouting, 'WTF IS GOING ON!?' time to time, it is still compelling and fun to experience. The multiplayer mode is fun, but still consists the same problems that every COD has had, mostly consisting of deaths you feel you didn't deserve, and obnoxiously overpowered shotguns. The new Specialist abilities are a great addition to the game and feel right at home in COD's frantic pacing. However, the best thing this game has to offer is the zombies mode.
